timeline.bodyText: We don't seem to wait here, just consuming the pending 'child zombie' tokens. I think this comment should be changed. Also, Shouldn't the current element instance still transition to terminated at the end of this else block?
timeline.author: korthout

replies.bodyText:
Nope. In this case, the element instance has child instances that are not terminated yet. So, it should wait until all child instances are terminated before it goes to terminated.
Does this make sense for you?
replies.author: saig0

replies.bodyText: Yes, but the code does not wait, it merely consumes the pending tokens. Or am I missing something?
replies.author: korthout

replies.bodyText:
Ok, I guess that my comment is not clear 😅  I'm open to suggestions.
"waiting" here means that the element instance doesn't go to terminated. Instead, it waits until the child instances are terminated.
It doesn't consume the tokens from the child instances 🤔 It consumes the tokens for the events that will not be processed anymore:

child instance completed doesn't pass the guard because the (flow scope) instance is not active
sequence flow taken doesn't pass the guard because the (flow scope) instance is not active

For both cases, the (flow scope) instance has a pending token. So, we need to "consume" these tokens to pass the check: https://github.com/zeebe-io/zeebe/blob/13a78a6fda2ba73c886c1d3f3087c48f18f0072e/engine/src/main/java/io/zeebe/engine/nwe/container/MultiInstanceBodyProcessor.java#L210-L228
